Entries.default: "Damn me for a buttered slice of hard tack! It's... it's you, ain't it?" The pale elf squints at you and puffs on her pipe. Acrid smoke from the bowl wreathes her face.
"My favorite scuttler! Ain't we in business yet?" Udita takes the pipe from her mouth and salutes.
"What bounties do you have available?"
"Farewell."
"Knew we'd be fast friends, I did!" She claps you on the shoulder and grins, her pipe wagging in her teeth.
"That can't be who I think it is..."
"I'll take the bounty."
"I've already dealt with Chornu."
"I'll pass on the bounty for now."

"Your next target is Kuaro, a Huana captain with a black mark on his name.

"He sees outlander ships like floating game ready to be harpooned."
"I'll take the bounty."
"I've already dealt with Kuaro."

"You'll be scuttling a Vailian captain next. Rock-Stomper Rodul is a mountain dwarf with a penchant for sinking freedom-lovers, so you'll be doing me a personal favor scuttling his craft." 

Udita re-ignites the bowl of her pipe and studies your expression.
"I'll take the bounty."
"I've already dealt with Rock-Stomper Rodul."

"Course you will! Knows a good opportunity when you sees it.

"Chornu helms the voyager Early Muster in the waters north of Neketaka and south of Sayuka."

"Kuaro helms the junk 'Kamat o Ngati' and lurks on the outskirts of the Kua o Rikuhu island chain, east of Neketaka.

"Good hunting, scuttler."

"I've no doubt you'll deliver on your word. 

"Rodul commands the galleon Goat's Horn in the open waters east of Neketaka."
"You don't have to worry about Chornu any longer."
"Kuaro rests in Ondra's watery embrace."
"I dealt with Rock-Stomper Rodul."

"Hope the navy doesn't trouble you none over it. They tend to hold a grudge." 

Shrugging, Udita passes you a pouch of coins.

"He's well-scuttled, then? Blimey but you're keen at this!"

Udita clamps down on her pipe and counts out a pouch of coins for you.

"Knowing the Deadfire waters are short a pirate hunter is worth ten times its weight in pires." 

Udita hefts a sack of coins almost too heavy for her to bear. She sighs at being rid of it and returns her attention to her pipe.

"Hate to say it, scuttler, but I'm tapped out. My client's gone awfully quiet, so we're both better off sailing for the next horizon." 

She clamps her teeth down on her pipe and sticks out her hand.
"Scuttler! Seeing your face is a delight, but I've got no work for you."
"Keen as I am to accept your offer, you've got your work cut out for you." She thumbs the curve of the pipe and shrugs.
"Before I go I had some questions."
"Farewell."
"Have on!" Udita chuckles and gestures for you to speak freely.
"Suit yourself, scuttler. Come back when your pockets have lightened some."
"I'm still hunting Kuaro."
"I'm still hunting Rock-Stomper Rodul."
"I'm still hunting Chornu."

"No one's barking at your heels for results, scuttler. The black mark finds everyone in their time." 

She squints down at the bowl of her pipe and frowns.
"If you don't catch them first, I wager Ondra will simply widen her jaws when she's good and hungry."
"Scuttle your current target before moving on to another, aye?"

"I'll keep it quick, see? If your little dinghy has got some chase in it, I've got a list of captains with a black mark to their name whose ships need a quick scuttling.

"And I'm in the market for a scuttler." 

She sticks the pipe in the side of her mouth and grins, showing a mouth full of yellow teeth.
"Do I know you?"
[Lie] "No it's not."
"You have me at a disadvantage, sister."

"Course not, but I know you like I know the curve of my eleventh toe."

She winks and shuffles closer.
"Playing it discreet? With a name like yours I don't envy the challenge."
"I'll think about it. Farewell."
"What makes you think I'd be interested?"

"Saying you're not? Me, I hear that you dive at coin like my second husband to the bottom of a cask."

She plucks the pipe from her mouth and leans in to scrutinize you.
"Never mind where I heard it - I heard it all the same, aye? Word gets around faster than pox. "So, we have a deal?"
"You're offering me a bounty? Where do I start?"

"You read me like a book, you do! Then let's talk business, aye?" 

She cracks her knuckles and grins.
"Wouldn't expect you to recognize me. Even back home I covered a lot of ground before taking to port here."
She takes the pipe from her mouth and glances away, sighing through her nose.
"What's the good word, scuttler?" Udita clamps her pipe in her teeth and grins.

"You'll be looking to scuttle Chornu first - one of Rauatai's finest, aye?

"I don't ask my client what he did or what scale his death balances. Safer to keep questions in the hold."
"Where do your bounties come from?"
"Better if you don't ask."
"Why not?"
"In that case, back to my other questions."

"Cause the Deadfire's in a big, ugly power play, it is.

"And not everyone gets quartered for being in the game."

"One captain - she's a piece standing twenty rounds distant from the real players. Another, he's a means to some unknowable end.

"Who's to say why they both need to die?" 

She gestures with her pipe in a broad, circular motion.
"And the type of clients who pays for the red work of scuttling? They don't blow the gaff to the help." She points first to you and then back to her before wedging the pipe back between her teeth.
"Noted. Farewell."
"Wise choice, scuttler." She replaces her pipe and winks.
"Hope that don't make you skittish none, loyalties being what they is." She clears her throat into her fist and glances off to the distance.

"I'll measure where my loyalties lie, thank you. If our target is worth his salt he'll send us down to Ondra's realm anyway." 

Maia folds her arms and nods stiffly.
"Mark me, but the bird lass thinks like she's true-born Príncipi, she does." Udita doffs her hat to Maia.

"[Player Name], captain of [Player Ship] - god chaser and fiend slayer!

"Must be expensive sustaining a reputation like that, eh?" She rubs her fingers together.

"Hey, you're better at this than I thought! You open to more work and more coin for your troubles?" 

She puffs on her pipe and leans in close.
"The Huana fleet cherishes him as a patriot, I say." Tekēhu worries the back of his head.
"Aye, knew you would." Udita winks.
"There's more work in your future - just give me the usual signal, eh?"
[Shake her hand.] "Pleasure working with you, Udita."
"Farewell."
"[Player Name], captain of [Player Ship], at your service."
"Hang me by the thumbs! 'At your service,' he says!"
Entries.female: "Hang me by the thumbs! 'At your service,' she says!"

Entries.default: [Toss Remaro's head at her feet.]

"He's well-scuttled, then? Blimey but you're keen at this!"

Udita clamps down on her pipe and counts out a pouch of coins for you.
"Scuttler! Seeing your face is a delight, but I've got no work for you."
